newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH IPB RAISES BASE RATE FIVE PERCENTAGE POINTS.
newsitem.headline: CZECH IPB RAISES BASE RATE FIVE PERCENTAGE POINTS.

text.p: The Czech bank Investicni a Postovni Banka a.s. said on Thursday that it would raise its base interest rate for new credit by five full percentage points to 22.3 percent, effective on June 2.

In a statement, it said the hike in the base rate meant its fixed short-term rates for new credit would rise to a minimum of 17.8 percent, with medium-term credit at a minimum 23.8 percent, and long-term credit at a minimum of 24.9 percent.
